title: 114_s2926
content: The "Science Prize Competitions Act of 2016" may be cited as the Act. Amendments to prize competitions are included in the Act. Section 24 of the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 is amended to include changes related to prize competitions. This includes inserting "competition" and "types" in subsection (c), and changing "prizes" to "prize competitions" in paragraph (4). In subsection (f), changes involve posting information on a publicly accessible website like www.challenge.gov and replacing "prize" with "cash prize purse" in paragraph (4). In amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980, changes are made to include prize competitions. This involves inserting "cash prize purse" in various subsections and paragraphs, as well as allowing agencies to waive certain requirements. In amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980, changes are made to include prize competitions. This involves inserting "cash prize purse" in various subsections and paragraphs, as well as allowing agencies to waive certain requirements. The amendments also allow for the administration of prize competitions by private sector entities. The amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 include provisions for prize competitions, allowing for the use of federal funds and donations from private sector entities to support cash prize purses. Agencies are prohibited from giving special consideration in exchange for donations. The amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 allow for prize competitions with cash prize purses funded by federal funds and private sector donations. Provisions prohibit agencies from giving special consideration for donations. The amendments to the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 allow for prize competitions with cash prize purses funded by federal funds and private sector donations. Provisions prohibit agencies from giving special consideration for donations. Amendments include changes to subparagraphs related to cash prizes, prize competitions, and agency-specific mission needs. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 allows for prize competitions funded by federal funds and private sector donations, with amendments focusing on cash prizes, prize competitions, and agency-specific mission needs for the upcoming fiscal years.
